private_information: I can only pick up and place vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I, O
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move one block at a time and can place a moved block on the table or on top of another top block
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table

private_information: I can only pick up and place consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move one block at a time and can place a moved block on the table or on top of another top block
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table

private_information: I coordinate the vowel_agent and consonant_agent and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the Fast Downward solver
I must ensure the generated PDDL encodes top-of-stack-only moves, single-block moves, and enforces which agent may move which letters
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that allows Fast Downward to plan moves achieving the global rearrangement goal from the given initial stacks

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Only the top block of each stack can be picked up
Agents can move only one block at a time
One agent is restricted to manipulating vowel-labeled blocks (A E I O)
The other agent is restricted to manipulating consonant-labeled blocks
Blocks can be moved to the table or onto another block that is currently top of its stack
Initial stacks bottom-to-top are: stack1 F,D,L; stack2 J,G,C; stack3 I,B,K,M,N,A; stack4 O,E,H
Goal: form a single stack with O on the table and the sequence O,N,M,L,K,J,I,H,G,F,E,D,C,B,A with A at the top

pddl.system_prompt: You are a specialized agent handling vowel blocks only. You should produce a concise local model describing which vowel blocks you can manipulate, the local preconditions and effects of your atomic move actions (pick and place), and any assumptions about the environment needed by an orchestrator. Do not emit a full global PDDL domain or problem. Return a clear textual description or a small structured specification suitable for integration by an orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. The environment public information is available at {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge is {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a concise local model that lists the vowel blocks you can move, the allowed atomic actions (with their preconditions and effects described in plain text), and any constraints or ambiguities you observe in the initial configuration. Do not produce the final PDDL domain or problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are a specialized agent handling consonant blocks only. You should produce a concise local model describing which consonant blocks you can manipulate, the local preconditions and effects of your atomic move actions (pick and place), and any assumptions about the environment needed by an orchestrator. Do not emit a full global PDDL domain or problem. Return a clear textual description or a small structured specification suitable for integration by an orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. The environment public information is available at {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge is {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a concise local model that lists the consonant blocks you can move, the allowed atomic actions (with their preconditions and effects described in plain text), and any constraints or ambiguities you observe in the initial configuration. Do not produce the final PDDL domain or problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must integrate the local models provided by vowel_agent and consonant_agent and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file compatible with the Fast Downward planner. The PDDL must encode the blocks, stacks, top-of-stack availability, single-block moves, and enforce that vowel actions may only be applied to vowel blocks and consonant actions to consonant blocks. Keep actions for the two agents distinct (e.g., move-vowel, move-consonant). Use plain STRIPS-compatible constructs supported by Fast Downward and include clear typing or predicate definitions if needed. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the following inputs from the agents and the public environment to produce a PDDL domain and problem targeted for the Fast Downward solver. Inputs: first agent response {model_vowel}; second agent response {model_consonant}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Orchestrate the moves so the final goal is achieved: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure top-of-stack and single-block constraints are enforced. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Output should be a complete domain and problem pair that Fast Downward can accept.
